review: I bought this for my brother as a Christmas present and when we got it setup I was shocked that Watch ESPN is not a pre-loaded app, you have to download it, and before you can do that you have to register an account at Amazon.  Guess I got snookered on this one.  The device seems to work well enough otherwise and my brother will reluctantly sign up with Amazon, JUST AS THEY DESIGNED IT ALL ALONG!!!Note to Amazon:  Just go ahead and give these things away free, you'll make it up on the required new accounts!

review: I really love the fire stick!!!! Still learning everything it does. We only have TV threw this . I have never felt the need to pay the high cost for cable. author: Carrie Moore

review: I ordered the Fire TV stick since I have the Amazon Prime membership.  Thought, what the heck, give it a try.  Just kept putting off installation because I dreaded it so much.  Decided today to give it a shot.  It took me every bit of 3 minutes to get it up and running.  Tutorial was awesome.  I don't have any negatives.  If I can set it up, anyone can.  I have a friend who offered to assist me with set up, but boy was I proud when I called her to tell her I had done it myself.  You have nothing to lose when you deal with Amazon.  Don't like it, send it back, but I promise if you try it, you will like it.
author: Patricia A. Ritchie

review: First I have a DVD player with the features that the Fire TV stick has except one and that is an App for the Amazon Music Library. I seem to have amassed a lot of music in the Library which I can  play on my cell or computer, or Download and copy to a USB and plug that into my DVD player to play through my sound system. Now I just switch to the Stick and play away.There are several things about the Fire Stick that I an not crazy about but if you don't have a 'Smart' TV or DVD player this will hook you up. But you will need Wi-Fi installed in your home. But  It certainly is worth the price and it's easy to hook up. One warning It hooks up to your TV with an HDMI cable, my TV only has two inputs so I had to pick up a small gadget that you attach to multiply your inputs.  Also you'll need a place to plug it in. The back of my TV looks like a jumble of snakes. And you have another remote to keep track of.
